subject: AI
title: AI Ethics Frameworks
description: Practical frameworks for making ethical decisions in AI development.

hook.text: Your AI could increase profits 20% by being more aggressive in recommendations. But it would mislead some users. Is it ethical? How do you decide?

buildup.text: AI ethics frameworks provide structured approaches: beneficence (does it help?), non-maleficence (does it harm?), autonomy (does it respect user choice?), justice (is it fair?), and explicability (can you explain it?).

discovery.text: Practical application: for every AI feature, run through a checklist: Who benefits? Who could be harmed? Are users aware? Can they opt out? Would you be comfortable if this was on the front page?

twist.text: Ethics frameworks don't give easy answers ‚Äî they surface the right questions. Two reasonable people can apply the same framework and reach different conclusions. That's the point.

climax.text: Adopt a framework, train your team on it, and apply it to every AI feature review. Even imperfect ethical review catches the worst decisions before they ship.

punchline.text: Ethics isn't about having all the answers. It's about asking the right questions before shipping.

quiz.question: What is the purpose of an AI ethics framework?
options: To guarantee that all decisions are correct
To provide structured approaches for surfacing ethical questions and tradeoffs
